item.title: Mandy add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "To the living we owe respect, but to the dead we owe only the truth." -- Voltaire

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "Memory is a snare, pure and simple; it alters, it subtly rearranges the past to fit the present." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "Perhaps it is better to wake up after all, even to suffer, rather than to remain a dupe to illusions all one's life." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Tatiana de Rosnay
Mandy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Love blurs your vision; but after it recedes, you can see more clearly than ever. It's like the tide going out, revealing whatever's been thrown away and sunk: broken bottles, old gloves, rusting pop cans, nibbled fishbodies, bones. This is the kind of thing you see if you sit in the darkness with open eyes, not knowing the future." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "It takes ten times as long to put yourself back together as it does to fall apart." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Jeff Noon
item.description: "There is a room in England somewhere, but it's nowhere to be seen. It exists only in the mind, and only in the mind of those that have been there." -- Jeff Noon
